data.description: The usually round, red edible fruit of a small tree, Malus sylvestris, of the rose family
The edible, usually bluish berry of various shrubs belonging to the genus Vaccinium, of the heath family.
One of the expanded, usually green organs borne by the stem of a plant.
A tropical plant of the genus Musa, certain species of which are cultivated for their nutritious fruit.
A globose, reddish-yellow, bitter or sweet, edible citrus fruit.
The red, acid fruit or berry of certain plants of the genus Vaccinium, of the heath family, as V. macrocarpon, used in making sauce, relish, jelly, or juice.
A plant, Solanum melongena esculentum, of the nightshade family, cultivated for its edible, dark-purple or occasionally white or yellow fruit.
The fruit, black or very dark purple when ripe, of certain species of the genus Rubus.
A form of cultivated plant, Brassica oleracea botrytis, of the mustard family, whose inflorescence forms a compact, usually whitish head.

The fruit of any of several shrubs belonging to the genus Rubus, of the rose family, consisting of small and juicy red, black, or pale yellow drupelets forming a detachable cap about a convex receptacle.

Any of several tropical American plants belonging to the genus Manihot, of the spurge family, as M. esculenta (bitter cassava) and M. dulcis (sweet cassava) , cultivated for their tuberous roots, which yield important food products.
